metadata.Title: CVE-2023-29537 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple race conditions in the font initialization could have led tomemory corruption and execution of attacker-controlled code. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox for Android < 112, Firefox < 112, and Focusfor Android < 112.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '112.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
mozjs38 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
